column2: MASSACHUSETTS PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. To drive defensively, you must:
column8: use the vehicle ahead as your only points of focus.
column10: keep one hand on the steering wheel.

column2: 2. The yield sign is ___ and white, with ___ letters.
column8: red; white

column2: 3. If a bus has signaled and is pulling back onto the roadway, you must:
column4: honk to let them know you’re there.
column8: move to the left lane.

column2: 4. The effects of alcohol on driving do NOT include:
column8: Improved coordination

column2: 5. What happens if two vehicles reach at the same time an intersection with four-way stop signs?
column6: The driver on the right yields to the driver on the left.
column8: The first vehicle to reach the intersection must yield.
column10: The driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.

column2: 6. When you approach this sign, you must:
column4: watch for workers crossing the road.
column8: stop if necessary.

column2: 7. ___________ normally are white rectangles with black letters or symbols.
column8: Warning signs

column2: 8. When driving at night, you should slow down and:
column4: use high beams whenever possible, but never when there's oncoming traffic.
column6: use high beams until other drivers dim their lights.
column8: follow the vehicle ahead more closely to avoid glare from oncoming headlights.
column10: come to a complete stop whenever there's oncoming traffic.

column2: 9. Air bags are meant to _________ seat belts.
column8: work with

column2: 10. You are driving and you are feeling drowsy. You should:
column4: turn on the radio to keep you awake.
column6: have a beer or two to keep you awake.
column8: find a safe place to stop for a break.

column2: 11. This sign warns drivers that:
column8: they will soon be facing oncoming traffic.

column2: 12. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.
column8: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.

column2: 13. An emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can be unpredictable. Why?
column4: The driver can legally pass red lights.
column6: Emergency vehicles must go faster than the posted speed limit when it is safe to do so.
column8: Emergency vehicle drivers are not required to be careful.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column6: All traffic must turn right at next intersection
column8: Right turn on red light permitted

column2: 15. You face a green light, but traffic on the other side of the intersection does not allow you to travel all the way through the intersection. What must you do?
column6: Wait until traffic ahead clears, so you do not block the intersection.
column8: Wait for the next green light.
column10: Enter the intersection and wait until traffic ahead clears.

column2: 16. To check your blind spot before changing lanes:
column4: look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move.
column8: look into the left side mirror.
column10: look into the right side mirror.

column2: 17. An edge line that angles toward the center of the road indicates that:
column8: there’s a narrow bridge ahead.

column2: 18. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column4: Adjust your schedule to drive during times with the most highway traffic.
column6: Allow enough travel time to reach your destination on schedule.
column8: Listen to heavy metal music.

column2: 19. You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:
column4: even if they are short sighted.
column8: if it’s raining.

column2: 20. This road sign means:
column8: Merging Traffic

column2: 21. The traffic light is green and you want to drive straight through an intersection. If a car is already in the intersection and is making a turn, you must:
column4: wait for the next green light.
column6: enter the intersection and then stop.
column8: drive through the intersection. You have the right-of-way.
column10: let that car complete its turn before you enter the intersection.

column2: 22. If your brakes are wet, you can dry them by:
column6: pull over to the right and wait until it stops raining.
column8: having them checked by a mechanic.

column2: 23. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: they must turn either to the right or left.
column6: there is a winding road ahead.
column8: there's an intersection ahead.
column10: there is a double curve ahead.

column2: 24. __________ limit(s) your concentration, perception, judgment, and memory.
column4: Only a blood alcohol level greater than the legal limit
column6: Even the smallest amount of alcohol
column8: Only a blood alcohol level greater than .05

column2: 25. This sign indicates:
column4: the maximum legal height allowed in this State.
column8: the maximum width of a vehicle allowed on the highway.
column10: the overpass ahead has a low clearance.
